results.title: La Direction des Acteurs
results.brief_description:
This short piece was filmed at the time Jean Renoir was preparing ‘The River’. In order to demonstrate his conception of directing, he asks Gisele Braunberger to audition for the role of the young protagonist of ‘The River’.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Braunberger ; director, Gisele Braunberger ; photography, Edmond Richard.
Cast: Jean Renoir, Gisele Braunberger.

results.title: Le Dernier Matin D'albert Camus
results.brief_description:
The life and work of Albert Camus, Nobel prize-winning novelist, playwright, journalist and essayist. This short documentary returns to places that have played a important role in Camus’ life; the ruins of Tippasa, his home in Lourmarin as well as the theatre which was to be his refuge from the trappings of celebrity. It is illustrated with a lengthy interview with the author. Also available in the NLA Collection (#2002445, 16mm).

Credits: Director, Harry Fishbach ; writers, Daisy Loriaux, Jean-Claude Brisville ; photography, Jean-Marie Boussaguet ; music, Rene Thomas, Maurice Jarre.
Cast: Text by Albert Camus interpreted by Michel Auclair, narration by Jacques Harden.

results.title: Toute la Memoire du Monde = All the Memory of the World
results.brief_description:
Following the journey of a book from its arrival at the Legal Deposit office, rue de Richelieu, to the consultation room, Alain Resnais takes the audience through the meanders of the French National Library and the treasures it contains. Resnais instructed his crew that he wanted to move through the library like a fish in water or like a rocket. This explains the fluidity of the travelling and tacking shots which gave the film such a dynamism while the subject was totally inert.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Braunberger ; director, Alain Resnais ; writer, Remo Forlani ; photography, Ghislain Cloquet ; music, Maurice Jarre, Georges Delerue.
Cast: Jacques Dumesnil [narration only].

results.title: Colette
results.brief_description:
“One never watches enough”. A chronological evocation of the life and work of Gabrielle Sidonie Colette, theatrical artist, writer and journalist.The documentary evokes her early writings (signed by her husband), her fascination for the complexities of love and relationships, as well as her enduring passion for cats.

Credits: Director, Edouard Berne ; photography, Dominique Chapuis ; music, Monique Rollin.
Cast: Hugette Lengagne [narration only].

results.title: Les Mistons = the Brats
results.brief_description:
The awakening sexuality of a group of boys during a summer in Nimes is focused on Bernadette, the sister of one of them, and her short-lived love affair with Gerard, a physical education teacher. The blend of sensuality and nostalgia, tenderness and irony recalls Renoir, especially ‘Partie de Campagne’. The voice-over narration ensures that we see Bernadette - the first of Truffaut’s succession of inacessible women - through the eyes of the boys.

Credits: Producer, Robert Lachenay ; director, Francois Truffaut ; photography, Jean Malige ; music, Maurice Leroux
Cast: Gerard Blain, Bernadette Lafont, Michel Francois [naration].

results.title: Evariste Galois
results.brief_description:
Evariste Galois made significant contributions to several branches of mathematics, particularly in the domain of equations. Astruc follows what is to be Galois’s last night before he is killed in a duel. Narrated by Jean Negroni.

Credits: Producer, Jean Salvy ; director, writer, Alexandre Astruc ; photography, Jacques Mercanton ; music, Antoine Duhamel.
Cast: Jose Varela, Vincent Kaldor, Francois Perrot, Gerard Dauzat, Jean Sobieski.

results.title: Marey
results.brief_description:
In 1862, Etienne-Jules Marey, a French physiologist, with an interest in movement, devised a camera with magazine plates that recorded a series of photographs. Once combined, the pictures would represent movement, and in particluar, the flight of birds. Marey’s invention is regarded as a forerunner of the modermn motion picture camera. See also: ‘Pioneers of Photography’ (Ep.07): ‘The Fleeting Image’ (Available on VHS and 16mm).

Credits: No credits available.
